description: Daria Tomenko initiates override in wearable firmware, rejecting Halden’s legacy plan. Decision triggers citywide prompt for immediate public governance vote.
An open digital forum launches across Stenograd, allowing all citizens to cast live votes on Council decisions, policies, and city priorities. Participation rapidly climbs.

Widespread citizen engagement overwhelms BCI controls, disrupting automated routines. Directorate's attempts to intervene are broadcast live, sparking digital protests and further forum participation.
Council leaders who supported restrictive policies are removed via public vote. Citizen-nominated delegates and grassroots organizers take provisional seats in the Council.
New policies are drafted and ratified by popular vote, dismantling the BCI's centralized control. Former 'vanished' citizens and grassroots advocates help shape open governance structures.
